key_responsibilities: serving as an on-the-record spokesperson
working with national and local media to highlight committee activities and advance the committee’s agenda
writing press releases, op-eds, talking points, and briefing materials
booking and preparing the Chairman for interviews
engaging key stakeholders
organizing press conferences
managing a team of digital and press staff
requirements: strong work ethic and close attention to detail
vision to develop a long-term communications blueprint that advances key objectives
ability to work independently and collaboratively
understanding of key policy areas, including constitutional, immigration, surveillance, and criminal justice issues

key_responsibilities: acting as the representative for the Congresswoman within their area of responsibility including answering casework correspondence, meeting with constituents, verbal communications with constituents, and serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies, persons or groups for effective relationships for the Congresswoman
informing the Congresswoman and the District Director of all happenings in their assigned issue areas by screening district media sources and interacting with constituents
handling casework assignments and assesses casework for problems requiring legislative action and makes recommendations to the District Director and Chief of Staff
monitoring scheduled district meetings for the Congresswoman with constituents
logging incoming and outgoing mail and incoming telephone calls relating to casework
preparing periodic reports for the Congresswoman and District Director on pending cases and district activities in his or her assigned issue areas
continually screening active cases and acts as liaison with constituents to ensure that their cases are handled in a responsive manner
maintaining up-to-date files on all cases and categories of information of importance to the office
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: excellent written and verbal communication skills
strong organizational and time management skills
an ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in an fast-paced work environment

key_responsibilities: overseeing Committee hearing and markup logistics
serving as assistant clerk during markups
providing administrative and research support to the Chief of Staff and Staff Director/Chief Counsel
coordinating the Chief of Staff, Staff Director/Chief Counsel, and the Committee’s calendars
co-managing the intern program
managing Committee administrative needs
requirements: strong research, writing, and communication skills

key_responsibilities: preparing briefing materials for meetings
advising the Congressman on all legislative areas within their portfolio
preparing vote recommendations
meeting with constituents and stakeholders on policy matters within their portfolio
drafting legislation, memos, and letters
requirements: 2-5 years of years of Hill experience

key_responsibilities: drafting hearing, markup, and floor remarks for senior committee members
writing op-eds, blog posts, press releases, and speeches to stakeholder groups
assisting with other communication duties including media relations, social media, and engagement with member offices
requirements: superb writing and grammar skills and attention to detail
minimum of 1 years of Capitol Hill or press experience

key_responsibilities: writing press releases, media advisories, and newsletters
crafting content for social media channels
developing graphics and videos
assisting with media monitoring and pitching press
overseeing clips collection and distribution
working with the Communications team to identify new ways to engage with press and digital audiences
acting as the formal spokesperson and media liaison for the Member
developing and implementing media and communications strategy for the Member
remaining abreast of current legislative and non-legislative issues about which the Member may be questioned
evaluating current events and media reports in the district and the nation for their impact on the Member
providing ideas and advice on the effect in the media of the Member’s actions and legislative activities
writing speeches for the Member
performing other duties as assigned
requirements: minimum of 4-6 years of congressional experience
strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills
understanding of print and broadcast media
knowledge of current issues and events in which the Member is involved
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Member's positions on policy issues
ability to work collaboratively with district office

key_responsibilities: assisting the Member in responding to constituent issues and problems with federal agencies
staying on top of everyday events in the Member’s district
keeping the community connected to the Member’s work
helping with neighborhood events
requirements: patience and skill in resolving the problems of constituents
ability to handle multiple tasks and issues effectively
significant experience interacting with the public
working knowledge or strong interest in the District of Columbia and its local government
willingness to become a resident of the District of Columbia
salary: based on skill and experience level

key_responsibilities: working with the Chief Counsel/Legislative Director and with the Chief of Staff to develop and implement the Member’s legislative strategy in his/her issue areas
preparing materials for hearings
drafting legislation, amendments, and congressional record statements
conducting research
requirements: strong interpersonal, legal and writing skills
ability to manage multiple tasks and work well under pressure
ability to write well under tight deadlines
willingness to become a resident of the District of Columbia
salary: based on skill and experience level

key_responsibilities: managing a busy press shop
being an excellent writer
being highly creative

being experienced with booking national news hits

prioritizing and publicizing Rep. Welch’s strategic goals across social media platforms
communications planning and press strategy for D.C. and the district
drafting press materials including remarks, talking points, statements, op-eds, press releases, and media advisories
assisting with the management of the Congressman’s social media accounts
interview preparation
fielding media inquiries

answering casework correspondence
meeting with constituents
verbal communications with constituents
serving as a liaison with federal, district, and local agencies and community organizations

executing various outreach activities

key_responsibilities: advising the Member on all legislative areas within their portfolio
preparing and staffing the Member in committee hearings and markups
drafting and advancing legislation
representing the Member in meetings with constituents and stakeholders concerning policy matters in their portfolio

conducting investigations
research

location: San Pedro, CA – Los Angeles County
key_responsibilities: overseeing management and operation of the District Office
serving as liaison to local organizations and elected officials
managing a team of 5-8 in the District including interns
developing and implementing long-term strategic plans, including but not limited to outreach, casework, and grants programs

ensuring that district staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures

serving as the primary liaison between the Congresswoman, constituents, and entities in the district
strategizing, developing, and implementing constituent outreach plans
managing casework
managing their own fieldwork book of business
working with the office’s scheduling team to implement an aggressive schedule of community events and outreach

acting as an advisor for the Congresswoman on local issues and concerns, politics, and other developments throughout the district, the Los Angeles metropolitan area, Southern California, and the state

outreach experience to local and state organizations
ability to work collaboratively with district office staff as well as D.C.-based legislative and communications staff
knowledge of the local, county, and statewide processes

key_responsibilities: reviewing financial statements
providing legal advice on a high volume of financial disclosure issues

sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

key_responsibilities: providing a high volume of ethics advice, education, and training to Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product
requirements: outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

key_responsibilities: assisting constituents of the 38th Congressional District resolve problems with federal agencies or find the appropriate state or local contact for non-federal issues
answering phones
greeting constituents and visitors
writing correspondence
assisting the District Office staff with additional tasks
requirements: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited four-year college or university

skilled in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point
ability to work efficiently and effectively as a member of a team, be able to meet strict deadlines, balance multiple projects simultaneously, and work under pressure
